regulate.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to control an activity or process, especially by rules
regulate.translation[0].definitions[0].e: strict rules regulating the use of chemicals in food
regulate.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to make a machine or your body work at a particular speed, temperature etc
regulate.translation[0].definitions[1].e: People sweat to regulate their body heat.
regulate.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to check that business activities, financial activities etc are legal and fair
regulate.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The Personal Investment Authority regulates the selling of ISAs to the public.
Many futures exchanges are closely regulated.
The City has so far failed to regulate itself effectively.
